title: "This Week In React #233: RSC, Next.js, Compiler, Unhead, Shadcn, Relay, Mantine | Expo, WebGPU, Skia, Apple fees, Reanimated, Fragment Refs | Node.js, TS, Prisma, Deno, GSAP"

segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

translations.en: Bonjour Ã  tous !

segments.source_content: This week we don't have one, but 2 interesting blog posts from Dan Abramov, and various React releases.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, nous avons non pas un, mais deux articles de blog intÃ©ressants de Dan Abramov, ainsi que diverses versions de React.
translations.en: Cette semaine, nous n'en avons pas un mais deux articles de blog intÃ©ressants de Dan Abramov, ainsi que diverses versions de React.

segments.source_content: I found the mobile news particularly interesting, with Expo 53, Skia Graphite, Reanimated Shared Elements Transitions, and the Apple fees court injunction.

translations.fr: J'ai trouvÃ© les nouvelles mobiles particuliÃ¨rement intÃ©ressantes, avec Expo 53, Skia Graphite, les transitions d'Ã©lÃ©ments partagÃ©s de Reanimated et l'injonction judiciaire sur les frais d'Apple.

segments.source_content: My fellows at ui.dev are also launching the final content of their [react.gg](https://react.gg/?ref=twir) course (30% off now), designed to teach you all the brand-new React 19 concepts from first principles. I got access to review it and can assure you that it's a really playful way to learn React, full of interactive examples, visualizations and pragmatic quizzes.

translations.fr: Mes collÃ¨gues chez ui.dev lancent Ã©galement le contenu final de leur cours [react.gg](https://react.gg/?ref=twir) (30% de rÃ©duction actuellement), conÃ§u pour vous enseigner tous les nouveaux concepts de React 19 Ã  partir des principes fondamentaux. J'ai eu accÃ¨s pour le relire et peux vous assurer que c'est une maniÃ¨re ludique d'apprendre React, remplie d'exemples interactifs, de visualisations et de quiz pragmatiques.
translations.en: Mes collÃ¨gues de ui.dev lancent Ã©galement le contenu final de leur cours [react.gg](https://react.gg/?ref=twir) (30% de rÃ©duction actuellement), conÃ§u pour vous enseigner tous les nouveaux concepts de React 19 Ã  partir des premiers principes. J'ai pu le consulter en avant-premiÃ¨re et peux vous assurer que c'est une mÃ©thode vraiment ludique pour apprendre React, pleine d'exemples interactifs, de visualisations et de quiz pragmatiques.

segments.source_content: Code reviews are critical but time-consuming. CodeRabbit acts as your AI co-pilot, providing instant Code review commentsÂ and potential impacts of every pull request.

translations.en: Les relectures de code sont essentielles mais chronophages. CodeRabbit agit comme votre copilote IA, fournissant instantanÃ©ment des commentaires de relecture et les impacts potentiels de chaque pull request.

segments.source_content: Beyond just flagging issues, CodeRabbit provides one-click fix suggestions and lets you define custom code quality rules using AST Grep patterns, catching subtle issues that traditional static analysis tools might miss.

translations.fr: Au-delÃ  du simple signalement des problÃ¨mes, CodeRabbit propose des corrections en un clic et vous permet de dÃ©finir des rÃ¨gles personnalisÃ©es de qualitÃ© de code en utilisant des motifs AST Grep, dÃ©tectant des problÃ¨mes subtils que les outils d'analyse statique traditionnels pourraient manquer.

segments.source_content: CodeRabbit has so far reviewed more than 5 million PRs, installed on 1 million repositories, and used by 50 thousandÂ Open-source projects.Â CodeRabbit is free for all open-source repo's. [Get started today!](https://coderabbit.link/this-week-in-react-7may-2025)

CodeRabbit est gratuit pour tous les dÃ©pÃ´ts open source. [Commencez dÃ¨s aujourd'hui !](https://coderabbit.link/this-week-in-react-7may-2025)

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Product for Engineers - What engineers get wrong about communication](https://go.posthog.com/twir-may7)
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js Docs \- New `runAfterProductionCompile` lifecycle hook](https://nextjs.org/docs/architecture/nextjs-compiler#runafterproductioncompile): Upcoming (unreleased) feature already documented.
- ğŸ’¬ [React Compiler oxc plugin](https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc/issues/10048): Interesting discussions between the React Compiler team and the oxc team to integrate the compiler as an oxc plugin for upcoming usage with Vite and Oxc/Rolldown. The React team suggests making it happen in 2 steps (make it work, then make it fast).
- ğŸ§µ [shadcn introducing the registry MCP \- One command to make any component registry mcp-compatible.](https://threadreaderapp.com/thread/1917597228513853603.html)
- ğŸ“œ [Functional HTML](https://overreacted.io/functional-html/): Dan gradually reinvents the HTML he wants from first principles, leading to an RSC implementation.
- ğŸ“œ [RSC for Astro Developers](https://overreacted.io/rsc-for-astro-developers/): RSC and Astro have 2 remarkably similar mental models, but Dan exposes some interesting subtle differences. RSCs may feel less intuitive at first, but they also solve some of Astroâ€™s limitations.
- ğŸ“œ [The future of AI interaction: Beyond just text](https://www.epicai.pro/the-future-of-ai-interaction-beyond-just-text-w22ps): Kent argues that MCPs could have a role to play in implementing generative UIs with React Server Components. He wants the protocol to allow richer return types like html and RSC payloads.
- ğŸ“œ [Frontends are hard](https://sst.dev/blog/frontends-are-hard): The devs at SST reflect on the challenges of self-hosting modern meta-frameworks, including React ones, that led them to start the OpenNext initiative.
- ğŸ“œ [Add a Color Scheme Toggle in React Router](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/add-a-color-scheme-toggle-in-react-router): This method avoids FOUC with a cookie instead of inlined JS.
- ğŸ“œ [Robust Data Fetching Architecture For Complex React/Next.js Apps](https://www.trevorlasn.com/blog/fetching-data-for-complex-next-and-react-apps): Suggests using 3 layers: Server Components, React Query, and Optimistic Updates.
- ğŸ“œ [Server Components Give You Optionality](https://saewitz.com/server-components-give-you-optionality): They give flexibility to choose in which environments your components run in (Server, Server+Client, or Client) and when.
- ğŸ“œ [How We Fell Out of Love with Next.js and Back in Love with Ruby on Rails & Inertia.js](https://hardcover.app/blog/part-1-how-we-fell-out-of-love-with-next-js-and-back-in-love-with-ruby-on-rails-inertia-js)
- ğŸ“œ [Why Kleinanzeigen.de Picked Astro Over Next.js](https://d13z.dev/blog/07-why-kleinanzeigen-picked-astro-over-nextjs/)
- ğŸ“œ [When You Might Need to Override the Defaults in TanStack Query](https://www.kxlaa.com/articles/when-you-might-need-to-override-the-defaults-in-tanstack-query)
- ğŸ’¸ [React.gg - The interactive way to master modern React, including new v19 modules - 30% off during launch week](https://react.gg/?ref=twir)
- ğŸ“¦ [Unhead 2.0 \- The full stack \<head\> package for any framework](https://unhead.unjs.io/v2): This framework-agnostic package from the UnJS ecosystem now includes React bindings. This could be a great drop-in alternative to `react-helmet` with React 19 support if the new built-in APIs are not good enough for you (see [my comment here](https://github.com/staylor/react-helmet-async/issues/239#issuecomment-2565685131)).
- ğŸ“¦ [Blade \- Build instant web apps with React](https://github.com/ronin-co/blade): A new opinionated React meta-framework with Server Components support, that purposefully doesnâ€™t comply with the RSC spec.
- ğŸ“¦ [Relay 19.0 \- `@alias` required on conditional fragments, support React 19](https://relay.dev/blog/2025/04/02/relay-19/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Mantine 8.0 \- Updated dates package, new TimePicker, Heatmap, CodeHighlight components, nested menus and more](https://mantine.dev/changelog/8-0-0/)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Error Boundary 6.0 \- ESM-only](https://github.com/bvaughn/react-error-boundary/releases/tag/6.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Admin 5.8 \- InPlaceEditor, DataTable, AuthLayout, MUI v7, CSS vars, theming](https://github.com/marmelab/react-admin/releases/tag/v5.8.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Unverceled Next.js \- A Next.js 15 Starter Kit Deployed to Cloudflare using OpenNext](https://github.com/ixahmedxi/unverceled-nextjs)
- ğŸ“¦ [Radix UI \- New unstable PasswordToggleField and Checkbox parts](https://www.radix-ui.com/primitives/docs/overview/releases#may-5-2025)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Router DevTools 5.0 \- Complete overhaul of the routes tab](https://github.com/forge-42/react-router-devtools/releases/tag/v5.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [MUI 7.1 \- Support for Tailwind CSS 4](https://github.com/mui/material-ui/releases/tag/v7.1.0)
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington \- React's New Activity Component: Huge Performance Win\!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gRKVL5w-2Lc)
- ğŸ¥ [Fireship \- The growing divide among React developersâ€¦](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lLJbHHeFSsE)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [Front-end Fire 93 \- React Activity, Storybook 9 Beta, and AI as a Collaborator](https://front-end-fire.com/episodes/93/)

segments.source_content: [![Expo SDK 53](/emails/issues/233/expo53.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/sdk-53)

translations.en: [![Expo SDK 53](/emails/issues/233/expo53.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/sdk-53)

segments.source_content: **[Expo SDK 53](https://expo.dev/changelog/sdk-53)**

translations.en: **[Expo SDK 53](https://expo.dev/changelog/sdk-53)**

segments.source_content: This is quite an impressive Expo release, with highlights:

translations.fr: Il s'agit d'une version assez impressionnante d'Expo, avec comme points forts :
translations.en: C'est une version d'Expo assez impressionnante, avec comme points forts :

segments.source_content:
- Upgrades to React Native 0.79, React 19, and RNW 0.20
- Turns the New Arch on by default
- Edge-to-edge on Android is enabled by default
- New [Expo BackgroundTask](https://expo.dev/blog/goodbye-background-fetch-hello-expo-background-task), a modern, reliable, power-efficient, and future-proof way to run background tasks using Android `WorkManager` and iOS `BGTaskScheduler` system APIs
- New [Expo Maps](https://expo.dev/blog/introducing-expo-maps-a-modern-maps-api-for-expo-developers) (alpha) built on Expo Modules API, using SwiftUI and Jetpack Compose, expose platform default Apple Maps and Google Maps components.
- Metro `package.json#exports` resolution enabled by default
- Deploy development builds to TestFlight with `npx testflight`
- Improve Android build times up to 25% with prebuilt Expo Modules
- And way more\!

translations.fr:
- Mises Ã  niveau vers React Native 0.79, React 19 et RNW 0.20
- Active la Nouvelle Architecture par dÃ©faut
- Le mode Edge-to-edge sur Android est activÃ© par dÃ©faut
- Nouveau [Expo BackgroundTask](https://expo.dev/blog/goodbye-background-fetch-hello-expo-background-task), une mÃ©thode moderne, fiable, Ã©conome en Ã©nergie et pÃ©renne pour exÃ©cuter des tÃ¢ches en arriÃ¨re-plan utilisant les API systÃ¨me `WorkManager` d'Android et `BGTaskScheduler` d'iOS
- Nouveau [Expo Maps](https://expo.dev/blog/introducing-expo-maps-a-modern-maps-api-for-expo-developers) (alpha) construit sur l'API Expo Modules, utilisant SwiftUI et Jetpack Compose, exposant les composants par dÃ©faut des plateformes Apple Maps et Google Maps.
- RÃ©solution Metro `package.json#exports` activÃ©e par dÃ©faut
- DÃ©ployez les builds de dÃ©veloppement sur TestFlight avec `npx testflight`
- RÃ©duisez les temps de build Android jusqu'Ã  25% avec les modules Expo prÃ©compilÃ©s
- Et bien plus encore !

- Mises Ã  niveau vers React Native 0.79, React 19 et RNW 0.20

- Nouveau [Expo BackgroundTask](https://expo.dev/blog/goodbye-background-fetch-hello-expo-background-task), une mÃ©thode moderne, fiable, Ã©conome en Ã©nergie et pÃ©renne pour exÃ©cuter des tÃ¢ches en arriÃ¨re-plan utilisant les API systÃ¨me `WorkManager` d'Android et `BGTaskScheduler` d'iOS
- Nouveau [Expo Maps](https://expo.dev/blog/introducing-expo-maps-a-modern-maps-api-for-expo-developers) (alpha) construit sur l'API Expo Modules, utilisant SwiftUI et Jetpack Compose, exposant les composants par dÃ©faut Apple Maps et Google Maps
- RÃ©solution `package.json#exports` de Metro activÃ©e par dÃ©faut
- DÃ©ploiement des builds de dÃ©veloppement sur TestFlight avec `npx testflight`
- RÃ©duction des temps de build Android jusqu'Ã  25% avec les Expo Modules prÃ©compilÃ©s
- Et bien plus encore !

segments.source_content: In a 37-minute video packed with exciting announcements, William Candillon and guests gave us a glimpse into the future of drawing and animation. Supported by Shopify, heâ€™s bringing modern WebGPU support (Vulkan and Metal) to React Native.

translations.fr: Dans une vidÃ©o de 37 minutes remplie d'annonces passionnantes, William Candillon et ses invitÃ©s nous ont offert un aperÃ§u du futur du dessin et de l'animation. Soutenu par Shopify, il apporte le support moderne de WebGPU (Vulkan et Metal) Ã  React Native.
translations.en: Dans une vidÃ©o de 37 minutes remplie d'annonces passionnantes, William Candillon et ses invitÃ©s nous ont offert un aperÃ§u du futur du dessin et de l'animation. Soutenu par Shopify, il apporte la prise en charge moderne de WebGPU (Vulkan et Metal) Ã  React Native.

segments.source_content: By aligning to the web APIs, it's possible to copy/paste existing web examples (including Three.js) and make them work on all platforms. It also enables general-purpose use of the GPU (AI, TensorFlow.js), which you may achieve more easily thanks to a convenient low-level TypeGPU library.

translations.fr: En s'alignant sur les APIs web, il est possible de copier/coller des exemples web existants (y compris Three.js) et de les faire fonctionner sur toutes les plateformes. Cela permet Ã©galement une utilisation gÃ©nÃ©rale du GPU (IA, TensorFlow.js), rÃ©alisable plus facilement grÃ¢ce Ã  une bibliothÃ¨que bas niveau pratique : TypeGPU.

Cela permet Ã©galement une utilisation polyvalente du GPU (IA, TensorFlow.js), rÃ©alisable plus facilement grÃ¢ce Ã  une bibliothÃ¨que bas niveau pratique TypeGPU.

segments.source_content: All this work was needed to create a new experimental Skia Graphite backend based on WebGPU. It enables composing and interleaving 2D/3D experiences in a performant way, like on the web, but across all platforms, with full Reanimated integration. Along the way, Skia doesnâ€™t come with any new feature, but has significantly improved performance, reduced, crashes, and supports 3 new platforms: tvOS, macOS and Node. Keep massaging that octopus William\!

translations.fr: Tout ce travail Ã©tait nÃ©cessaire pour crÃ©er un nouveau backend expÃ©rimental Skia Graphite basÃ© sur WebGPU. Il permet de composer et d'entrelacer des expÃ©riences 2D/3D de maniÃ¨re performante, comme sur le web, mais sur toutes les plateformes, avec une intÃ©gration complÃ¨te de Reanimated. Au passage, Skia n'apporte pas de nouvelle fonctionnalitÃ©, mais a considÃ©rablement amÃ©liorÃ© les performances, rÃ©duit les plantages, et prend en charge 3 nouvelles plateformes : tvOS, macOS et Node. Continue de masser cette pieuvre William !

Skia n'introduit aucune nouvelle fonctionnalitÃ©, mais amÃ©liore significativement les performances, rÃ©duit les plantages, et prend en charge 3 nouvelles plateformes : tvOS, macOS et Node. Continue de masser cette pieuvre William !

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [React Universe Conf 2025 adds new speakers: V. Morozov & K. Hosany (Microsoft), K. Hansen (MongoDB), Z. Chapple (Zephyr Cloud) and more.](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/?utm_campaign=7310698-RUC%202025&utm_source=TWIR&utm_content=New%20Speakers)
- âš–ï¸ [Epic Games Wins Major Victory as Apple is Ordered to Comply With App Store Anti-Steering Injunction](https://www.macrumors.com/2025/04/30/apple-app-store-anti-steering-injunction-violation/): A court judged that Apple purposefully did not comply with a former injunction to let apps use alternative payment methods and bypass the 30% fee on in-app purchases. â€œFor this Court, there is no second bite at the appleâ€. A major event for the mobile industry that enables Fortnite to return, the Kindle app to finally sell e-books directly, and new business models. Check [Expo](https://expo.dev/blog/mobile-app-payment-processing-best-practices) and [Vercel](https://vercel.com/blog/ios-developers-can-now-offer-commission-free-payments-on-web) guides and starters to avoid the fee.
- ğŸ‘€ [React Core PR \- Add Fragment Refs to Fabric with intersection observer support](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/33056): The recent React Labs post briefly mentioned an upcoming [Fragment Refs](https://react.dev/blog/2025/04/23/react-labs-view-transitions-activity-and-more#fragment-refs) feature. It looks like in the future weâ€™ll be able to use a web-like IntersectionObserver to know when a React fragment enters the screen. Still research/work-in-progress, but exciting new features ahead.
- ğŸ‘€ [Reanimated PR \- Shared Elements Transitions on the New Architecture](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/pull/7466): Exciting draft PR from Software Mansion that plans to stabilize Shared Elements Transitions for the New Architecture (that enables sharing C++ code between platforms).
- ğŸ“œ [Sirens, Sagas, and Stack Traces: A React Native Upgrade Odyssey](https://shift.infinite.red/sirens-sagas-and-stack-traces-a-react-native-upgrade-odyssey-52db6beb0aac)
- ğŸ”¨ [Package Checker \- Check for New Architecture compatibility](https://react-native-package-checker.vercel.app/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Compose Multiplatform 1.8 \- Compose Multiplatform for iOS Is Stable and Production-Ready](https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/05/compose-multiplatform-1-8-0-released-compose-multiplatform-for-ios-is-stable-and-production-ready/): The cross-platform UI toolkit from JetBrains enables code sharing between iOS and Android. Unlike React Native, the iOS (and web) support is based on Skia, not using UIKit native elements.
- ğŸ“¦ [Zustand 5.0.4 \+ Jotai 2.12.4](https://github.com/pmndrs/jotai/discussions/3041): Fixing an incompatibility issue with RN 0.79 / Expo 53 / Metro 0.82.
- ğŸ“¦ [Nitro Audio Manager \- Nitro module for AVAudioSession/AudioManager APIs](https://github.com/ChristopherGabba/react-native-nitro-audio-manager)
- ğŸ“¦ [Expo Build Disk Cache \- A plugin for Expo CLI to improve build time](https://github.com/WookieFPV/expo-build-disk-cache)
- ğŸ“¦ [Expo App Template \- Modern, sensible defaults and fast Expo app template](https://github.com/nkzw-tech/expo-app-template)
- ğŸ¥ [Jamon Holmgren \- How to build a Mac app with React Native for macOS](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0h-owMCfy5s)
- ğŸ¥ [React Universe Meetup \- 3 new videos from April: Polygen, File-based router, native feel](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZ3MwD-soTTEFaxmATqOTcitPEK5iaz1z)
- ğŸ¥ [Simon Grimm \- Finally React Native UI Components (Expo 53\)](http://youtube.com/watch?v=kGUrNO8WmCU)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [React Native Radio 330 \- and Accessibility with Karly Lamm](https://infinite.red/react-native-radio/rnr-330-react-native-and-accessibility-with-karly-lamm)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [Rocket Ship 67 \- Quitting RN, React Compiler, Legend List & RN Performance](https://share.transistor.fm/s/18111ecc)
